channel.title: Adding a port
channel.description: Hello, I am new to the forum and hate to start it with an annoying and probably obvious question so I apoligize. I need help adding a port. This is how I get to my ports (just saying this because some computers you can go to control panel+security center+ add port, but with my computer you can't do it that way.) 1. Right-click My Computer, and then click Properties. 2. On the Hardware tab, click Device Manager. 3. In Device Manager, locate the Ports section. That is how I get to my ports, but I have no idea like how to add a new one. When I click on the port tab it has two bullets. One says Communications Port(com1) and the other says ECP Printer Port (LTP1). IO need to add port 22 and 43594 because my computer wont run any servers with those ports. :confused:

item.title: Adding a port
item.dc:creator: @gamer12892 gamer12892
item.description:
@gamer12892 wrote:

Hello, I am new to the forum and hate to start it with an annoying and probably obvious question so I apoligize. I need help adding a port. This is how I get to my ports (just saying this because some computers you can go to control panel+security center+ add port, but with my computer you can’t do it that way.)

  1. Right-click My Computer, and then click Properties.
  2. On the Hardware tab, click Device Manager.
  3. In Device Manager, locate the Ports section.
    That is how I get to my ports, but I have no idea like how to add a new one. When I click on the port tab it has two bullets. One says Communications Port(com1) and the other says ECP Printer Port (LTP1). IO need to add port 22 and 43594 because my computer wont run any servers with those ports.

Read full topic
